Posts.Content: Aug 7, 2011 04:34AM Tiger_Blood wrote: Abatellik and tlaquapaque... I am also a young mom with a 5 year old....well not as young as you,,,,I just turned 34. The surgery is tough for the kids as they can't cuddle and jump on you the same way for a few days...The pain for me as been pretty minimal but I am sure everyone is different. My son is pretty fascinated by the drain. I, on the other hand, cannot even bear to look at it. I took my wrappings off last night and took a shower. I was okay and did not flip out over the flat area which once was my breast. The bitch tried to kill me is what I keep saying to myself. I wil recommend purchasing a lanyard to place around your neck when you do take showers to help hold the drains. The closer the drain is to your body the less discomfort you may feel. Happy Sunday!
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 16, 2011 06:46PM Tiger_Blood wrote: Hi Everyone, Just checking in. I am now 10 Days post surgery. I want to give everyone a heads up about making sure they drink lots of water with their meds. Last Monday I had to take myself to the ER because I was having severe heartburn and back pain. I could not take a drink of water without being in pain. You know the hospital pain scale? Well, this pain was like a 9. At the ER they did a chest x ray and a lung ct scan just in case there was cancer or a blood clot but that all came back clear. The gave me a GI numbing cocktail and that seemed to help and some ativan for the pain. I left with a diagnosis with inflamed esphagus and to follow up with a GI doc. Today, I went to the GI doc and he is almost sure that one of meds got stuck and burned some ulcers in my GI track. He believes it was the Cleomyacin. This whole experience has been worse than the masectomy. I am now down 14 lbs in a week and a half because it hurts to eat. I go for an endoscope next week to make sure the med still is not lodged in there somewhere. For all those facing surgery.......good luck. You can do it! This will be one more step to check off in your road to wellness!
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2011 03:26AM Tiger_Blood wrote: Hi All! It's been a while since I last checked in. I went back to work last week and have been super busy. My son starts school next week so I have been prepping for that, too! Looks like everyone is doing great. I have an appt with the RO next Thursday so I guess off to the Sept Rads board. Wishing everyone a quick recovery!
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2011 05:50AM Tiger_Blood wrote: I am scheduled this Thursday for a UMX. Scared to death. I hate being put under...
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 10, 2011 07:30AM Tiger_Blood wrote: Lillylady- I am so happy that your surgery went well! I have been praying hard for you. Now, what is next for you? I get my drain out on Friday. For those of you who have had theirs taken out, please tell me your xperience. I have had a rough time since Monday and not from my surgery. I was having severe chest pain and upper back pain and burping. The pain was so severe that I had to go to the er. They did some heart tests, lung scans, and chest xray and those turned out good. Looks like I have esphogusitis. It happens to chemo kids because of the rapid cell division. It is terrible and it is hard for me to eat or drink. They say it should resolve itself in a week or so. This was NOT the way I planned on shedding those extra pounds. Good luck to all facing surgery this week. Prayers for everyone.s
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2011 05:21PM Tiger_Blood wrote: Lilylady! No worries on the hysteria. The drainage tubes were yucky with a capital Y. The BS's lie to us and tell us they are not uncomfortable and then they lie again and tell us removal does not hurt. Yea right......Let me put a plastic tube the size of a straw in your side and yank it out. Today, I am having some pain but it is sore to the touch. I had my Herceptin today so maybe I am a little achy. Also...I was able to eat!!!! Yippee! I hope you get to feeling better soon. I just had a chocolate malt from UDF so all is right in the world!
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 5, 2011 02:48PM Tiger_Blood wrote: Hello all! Well, I just got home from the hospital and I am going to knock on wood here....It was not what I expected. I feel like I had more pain from the birth of my child. I am walking around and doing fine. A bit tired, but I think that is from getting woken up about 2 times last night to take vitals and to drain my tube. My BS said she was pleased and she felt that my body responded well to the Chemo. My tumor was 10 cm and it had shrunk it completely. It had just turned into soft tissue. She also said my nodes looked good. Now, just waiting on the path report....praying hard it comes out as expected.....please! The pain is not bad at all. When I got out of recovery they asked my if I wanted any pain medication. I asked them what my choices were and the nurse replied...morphine or percoset. I said, well, I have always wanted to try morphine so let's try that. I guess I was channeling my old wild rocker high school years on that one. Side note. All it did was made me sleepy. The drain is what makes me crazy. I have a phobia of things attached to me. Reason as to why I am probably one of the only chemo patients at my clinic without a port. It does not hurt...it just feels weird. I am icing like crazy to prevent swelling. I love the ice pak they give you. I do feel a bit bizzaro with my uni boob. When my hubby and I were in the elevator to go home I asked him...did you ever think you would marry a girl with only one boob. He replied...no, I thought I would marry a girl like on the movie Total Recall with 3 boobs. So...if anyone has any questions ask me or private message me....I promise to be honest and my UMX experience. Thanks for all ur support and good luck lilylady.....I am praying hard for you!!!!!!!
Posts.Title: August 2011 Surgery Group blondelawyer Joan811

Posts.Content: Aug 3, 2011 03:18PM Tiger_Blood wrote: Hi All! I am frantically trying to get everything prepped before my surgery tomorrow. You know, birthday gifts purchased, sheets washed, bills paid....the usual stuff. Ha Ha. I am so eager to get this step BEHIND me! I mean or real,,,,who would think that I would be losing a body part tomorrow? I laugh when I say this. My humor is slightly morbid. My father assures me that I am only losing fatty nasty tissue. Gotta love my dad, I had to tell my 5 year old that I was losing my breast, I couldn't hide that nor did I want to lie to him. I thought about it carefully and Â said it will grow back. I said Yes, kind of! He was so okay with it. He has been awesome through all this. The only thing I has had trouble with was me losing my hair. He was a notorious hair twirler when we would cuddle together. For my Ohio gals....I live in Cincinnati, right by Kings Island. My BS says that UMX is one night's stay; however, the Pre-Op nurse says I could go home that evening. Fine by me...GET ME OUT OF THERE! My surgery is an arrival at 5am and a 7am surgery time. All I can say is that they better have that IV full of coffee because I am nasty without it. I will post soon. Requesting all your thoughts, prayers, and good vibes. Â

Posts.Content: Tiger_Blood wrote: I am so over it right now. I am at MD Anderson and just feel like packing my bags and calling it quits. I miss my 5 year old son who keeps crying for his mommy and daddy to come home. I have been on Xeloda and Tykerb for 2 months now and had some follow up scans this week. We saw more Progression in the bones and small activity in the brain. The doctor ordered an MRI saying that the PET is not the best way to determine if it is mets. I get a pelvic cT done too since that is where he saw Progression. He did saw sometimes bone growth will light up the PET. I am sick to death and so over it!!!!!! I feel like all my options are exhausted if this is the case. Please pray not just for me but for my darling son. He adores me and always says if I go to heaven he wants to go with me. Lots of tears today. My wife has Tiger Blood. Winston Churchill: If you are going through hell, keep going Dx 3/7/2011, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Jan 30, 2012 11:57PM - edited Jan 31, 2012 12:01AM by Tiger_Blood LuaAnn, I go too OHC too. I see Dr Crane and really like him. I guess my first go around at this left a bad taste in my mouth. My old onc I felt like just a number to. The whole time during my first chemo I never received one scan. I probably was stage 4 from the beginning. When my md Anderson doc recommended WBR I asked him point blank "I know you have a wife and children. If this was your wife and you lived far away, what would you do?" without hesitation he said he would stay here since he felt like they were better equipPed. I know dr crane does the txm1 trial . I need to put a call out to him. After radiation my md doc says navelbine and herceptin. I too do not fear death but worry so much about my little Leo. My hubby. An soldier on. He is a handsome and loving husband and I am sure there will be women beating down my front door when I take my last breath. Would love to meet you. I am just so sad right now. My bone mets dx was a walk in the park. This has me knocked out.

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2012 04:20PM Tiger_Blood wrote: Coolbreeze: Have you looked at the Tory Burch flats? I am in love with mine. I adore fashion too. After each cancer milestone I treat myself to a purchase. When I finished my 1st round of chemo I bought myself a Marc Jacobs purse. I carry that thing constantly! When they discovered bone mets I bought myself a pair of TB flats. Now I finished 10 rounds of WBR and need to treat myself to something. Any ideas? I loved the pants you profiled but since I was on the steroids I can't stop eating or crying for that matter! Today is a cold cold day in ohio! I am sitting here while my father and hubby caters to me and watching my son play spiderman on playstation. He is 5 and we took him to NYC this holiday and we saw the broadway show. Now, he wants to move to the city and perform on stage. Okay by me. They have Sloan Kettering there, right? While we were there hubby even said.....we could live there if we wanted to move! Tonight is the oscars and I plan on fashion policing all the stars. The buttery popcorn sounds like a fab idea! I too started to watch downtown Abby and just saw that weeds was on Netflix again. I stopped watching weeds because what's her name didn't like Conrad.

Posts.Content: Tiger_Blood wrote: 5/6/16 Katie went to her "New Home" as she put it. She was an amazing mother, wife, and aunt. She loved our son Leo more than anything here on earth. When Katie first was diagnosed, her #1 goal was to see him turn 10. She felt that he would be old enough to remember her, and strong enough to cope with her loss. She enjoyed some wonderful times and battled through much adversity to make sure that happened, but she accomplished her goal. She fought hard for 5 years and made lifelong memories for me, Leo, and her friends. Her legacy of living for the moment lives on with all who knew her. We love you Katie Jo and we will see you again. My wife started coming to these boards about five years ago. I originally signed up for her account to find out what I could do to help her during her chemo treatments. She then took the account over. She made many friends and lost many over that time. She did not come on much after Lilylady passed as it affected her deeply. She would have been 39 in 2 weeks. http://www.tuftsschildmeyer.com/obituary/Katie-Jo-Rupert/Maineville-OH/1614697 My wife has Tiger Blood. Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2011 06:41AM Tiger_Blood wrote: I am new, too! Originally DX as Stage 3 March 2011 then just moved up a few weeks ago. I was getting simulated for my rads when the x ray showed something weird. A MRI later, bone scan, and a trip to MD Anderson for a PET and bone biopsy showed mets to spine and a few other places. Has no pain and was quite shocked! I am HER 2. Currently, taking Xeloda and tykerb. Will go back to MD Anderson at the end of January to see how those two work for me. I am a 34 year old mother to a 5 year old and a wife. I try to work full time and I work in the beauty industry as a Marketing Director for Aveda. I live in Cincinnati. So far, I have handled my DX, okay. I come here for support but am quite shy when posting. Many of you I look up to!

Posts.Content: Jan 8, 2013 02:24PM Tiger_Blood wrote: Here's a quick summary. Her2 is an aggressive cancer but treatable. We have a ton of targeted therapies and one on its way soon. Grade 3 is how aggressive the tumor is. Its a scale from 1-3. I assume she will do chemo first off. She will most likely be on Perjeta, Herceptin, and Taxotere. It's the newest first line tx for Her2 cancer right now.

Posts.Content: Mar 5, 2013 07:17AM Tiger_Blood wrote: Well you guys are going to laugh. I actually smoke marijuana to increase my appetite in the evening. I didn't want Marinol because I saw a woman in the chemo lounge who was on it and she was talking all kinds of weird stuff. I asked the nurse if she is okay and she said she was on Marinol. I chose to smoke it because you can control the dosage. I wish it was legalized here in Ohio. It's benefits far outweigh the cons. I don't do it if I am around my son or when he is in my care. Usually after his bedtime. Then I eat ALOT and catch up on all my DVR recordings. My MO says to me "whatever works is fine with me". My weight now is 124. I don't like to go below 127. I have not had a supply for about a week now and have lost 3 pounds. Getting resupplied today. The Megace works too. It was originally created for AIDS patients to increase their appetite. It does work but I always regurgitate. My hubby does not mind because I eat and laugh at all his jokes. And like I said before I can control it.
Posts.Title: meds to help you eat/gain weight allisontom911 Heidihill

Posts.Content: Tiger_Blood wrote: Hi! I thought I was at the finish line; however, last week was my brain scan and body scan. I've been Stage 4 sine 2011. I have to have a cranio because there is a cyst on a dead tumor. my head is NED. I blew through a poop ton of tx's and then finally found Kadcyla. I had a great run. 2 years plus. NEW SCAN have now a small spot on lunch and pelvic. IM so pissed. For those of you, who have FAILED Kadcyla, throw me some options! im thinking maybe throw in the towel My wife has Tiger Blood. Winston Churchill: If you are going through hell, keep going Dx 3/7/2011, IDC, 6cm+, Stage IV, Grade 2, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
